subject: Real Estate
title: The Rise of REITs
description: A fast breakdown of The Rise of REITs for builders.

hook.text: In 1960, President Eisenhower signed a law letting ordinary investors own shares of large properties.

discovery.text: REITs must pay out 90% of income as dividends, making them popular with income-seeking investors.

twist.text: You could now own a piece of a skyscraper for the price of a single stock share.

climax.text: Today, REITs control over $4 trillion in assets. Real estate became as liquid as the stock market.

punchline.text: REITs turned buildings into tradeable stocks.
